sen.j: 上毛野国造（かみつけぬのくにのみやつこ・かみつけぬこくぞう・かみつけののくにのみやつこ・かみつけのこくぞう)は上野国を支配した国造。
sen.e: Kamitsukenunokuninomiyatsuko (also known as Kamitsukenukokuzo, Kamitsukenokuninomiyatsuko, and Kamitsukenokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled Kamitsuke Province.

Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Kamitsukenukokuzo, Kamitsuke no kuninomiyatsuko, and Kamitsukenokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Kamitsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Kamitsukenukokuzo, Kamitsuke no kuninomiyatsuko, and Kamitsukenokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Kamitsuke Province.

sen.j: もと毛野国造で、仁徳朝～孝徳朝に下毛野国造と分裂した。
sen.e: This post was originally Kenunokuninomiyatsuko, which was divided into Kamitsukenunokuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenunokuninomiyatsuko during the period from the reign of Emperor Nintoku to the reign of Emperor Kotoku.

This post was originally Kenu no kuninomiyatsuko, which was divided into Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko during the period from the reign of Emperor Nintoku to the reign of Emperor Kotoku.

This post was originally Kenu no kuninomiyatsuko, which was divided into Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko during the period from the reign of Emperor Nintoku to the reign of Emperor Kotoku.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によると、崇神天皇の皇子豊城入彦が東国統治を命じられ、上毛野国造や下毛野国造などの祖先になったという。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki", Toyokiiruhikonomikoto, who was a Prince of Emperor Sujin and ordered to rule Togoku, was the ancestor of Kamitsukenunokuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenunokuninomiyatsuko.

According to "Nihonshoki", Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, who was a Prince of Emperor Sujin and ordered to rule Togoku, was the ancestor of Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko.

According to "Nihonshoki", Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, who was a Prince of Emperor Sujin and ordered to rule Togoku, was the ancestor of Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko.

sen.j: また、その孫の彦狭嶋王が景行朝に東山道十五国都督に任じられ、その子御諸別王も引き続き、善政を行ったという。
sen.e: It is said that Hikosashimanomiko, a grandson of Toyokiiruhikonomikoto, was appointed Tosando Jugokoku Totoku during the reign of Emperor Keiko, and his son Mimorowakenokimi succeeded him and governed well.

It is said that Hikosashima no miko, a grandson of Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, was appointed Tosando Jugokoku Totoku during the reign of Emperor Keiko, and his son Mimorowake no kimi succeeded him and governed well.

It is said that Hikosashima no miko, a grandson of Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, was appointed Tosando Jugokoku Totoku during the reign of Emperor Keiko, and his son Mimorowake no kimi succeeded him and governed well.

sen.j: 毛野氏。
sen.e: The Mori clan.

sen.j: 姓は君。
sen.e: Kabane was Kimi.
Kabane was Kimi.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年(684年)に朝臣を賜った。
sen.e: The clan was conferred on Asomi in 684, which was the 17th year of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.
The clan was conferred on Asomi in 684, which was the 17th year of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.
The clan was conferred on Asomi in 684, which was the 17th year of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 東国統治を担当し、しばしば蝦夷と交戦した。
sen.e: The clan took charge of ruling Togoku and frequently fought Emishi.
The clan took charge of ruling Togoku and frequently fought Emishi.
The clan took charge of ruling Togoku and frequently fought Emishi.

sen.j: 祭神は大己貴命・豊城入彦命。

He was dispatched as Kenshiragishi during the reign of Emperor Nintoku.

sen.j: 白鹿を発見して天皇に献上したという。

sen.j: 一度は蝦夷に敗れたが、妻の機転で巻き返したという。
sen.e: He was once defeated by Emishi, but with his wife's quick thinking, he rolled back the tide of war.
He was once defeated by Emishi, but with his wife's quick thinking, he rolled back the tide of war.

sen.j: 同地域には東日本最大規模を誇る天神山古墳ほか多数の古墳があり、大和政権と異なる一大国家をなしていた可能性がある。
sen.e: As many mounds including Tenjinyama kofun, the biggest kofun in the eastern Japan, are found in this area, there might have been a big country different from the Yamato Kingdom.
As many mounds including Tenjinyama kofun, the biggest kofun in the eastern Japan, are found in this area, there might have been a big country different from the Yamato Kingdom.
